org.imaginea.test.automation.framework.datastore

Class GlobalDataStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.imaginea.test.automation.framework.datastore.GlobalDataStore

  • public class GlobalDataStore
extends Object
    A global data store class to store the data that can be used in your tests. The class provide utility to store the data as a static data as well as for a thread. This is helpful when you want to share a particular data across multiple tests in a execution or in a particular thread when you are executing tests in parallel.
    Author:
    Varun Menon

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static GlobalDataStore getInstance()
        Use this method to get the instance of the of this class.
        Returns:
        GlobalDataStore singleton instance

      • putStaticData

        public void putStaticData(String key,
                 Object value)
        Stores data in a static way this data will available to the whole execution.
        Parameters:
        key - Name to be used to refer to the said data.
        value - The data object that you need to store this can be any object.

      • putThreadData

        public void putThreadData(String key,
                 String value)
        Stores data in way that is will be available for a particular thread. This usefule when you executing tests in a multi-threaded environment and want to share certain data across particular thread and not across whole execution.
        Parameters:
        key - Name to be used to refer to the said data.
        value - The data object that you need to store this can be any object.

      • getThreadData

        public <T> T getThreadData(String key)
        Use this method to retrieve the data that has been stored for a particular thread.
        Parameters:
        key - The key which was used to store the data
        Returns:
        The value stored for the said key or null in case no key was found.

      • getStaticData

        public <T> T getStaticData(String key)
        Use this method to retrieve the data that has been stored to be available across the whole execution.
        Parameters:
        key - The key which was used to store the data
        Returns:
        The value stored for the said key or null in case no key was found.

      • getThreadData

        public <T> T getThreadData(String key,
                  Object defaultValue)
        Use this method to retrieve the data that has been stored for a particular thread.
        Parameters:
        key - The key which was used to store the data
        defaultValue - The default value that needs to be returned in case the key is not found.
        Returns:
        The value stored for the said key or the given defaultValue in case no key was found.

      • getStaticData

        public <T> T getStaticData(String key,
                  Object defaultValue)
        Use this method to retrieve the data that has been stored to be available across the whole execution.
        Parameters:
        key - The key which was used to store the data
        defaultValue - The default value that needs to be returned in case the key is not found.
        Returns:
        The value stored for the said key or the given defaultValue in case no key was found.
